short_description: fastpath function to extracts the sentiment (positive, negative, or neutral) of each input document or sentence, using a dictionary model.
long_description: fastpath function to extracts the sentiment (positive, negative, or neutral) of each input document or sentence, using a dictionary model.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains input data.
input_tables.description: The relation that contains input data.

input_tables.name: CustomDictionaryTable
input_tables.rDescription: The CustomDictionaryTable ON clause can be used if the user wants to use his own custom dictionary table.
input_tables.description: The CustomDictionaryTable ON clause can be used if the user wants to use his own custom dictionary table.

input_tables.name: AdditionalDictionaryTable
input_tables.rDescription: The AdditionalDictionaryTable ON clause can be used If the user wants to add additional entries to either CUSTOMDICTIONARYTABLE or default dictionary.
input_tables.description: The AdditionalDictionaryTable ON clause can be used If the user wants to add additional entries to either CUSTOMDICTIONARYTABLE or default dictionary.

output_tables.name: OutputDictionaryTable
output_tables.rDescription: Name for the table that the function will generate which will contain the dictionary contents used during the sentiment analysis.
output_tables.description: Name for the table that the function will generate which will contain the dictionary contents used during the sentiment analysis.

argument_clauses.name: TextColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table column that contains the text data from which to extracts the sentiments.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table column that contains the text data from which to extracts the sentiments.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table columns to copy to the output table. By default, the function doesn't copy any input table columns to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table columns to copy to the output table. By default, the function doesn't copy any input table columns to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: AnalysisType
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the level of analysis - whether to analyze each document (default) or each sentence in a document.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the level of analysis - whether to analyze each document (default) or each sentence in a document.

argument_clauses.name: Priority
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the highest priority when returning results: {NONE, NEGATIVE_RECALL, NEGATIVE_PRECISION, POSITIVE_RECALL, POSITIVE_PRECISION}.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the highest priority when returning results: {NONE, NEGATIVE_RECALL, NEGATIVE_PRECISION, POSITIVE_RECALL, POSITIVE_PRECISION}.

argument_clauses.name: OutputType
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the kind of results to return: {ALL, POSITIVE, NEGATIVE, NEUTRAL}.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the kind of results to return: {ALL, POSITIVE, NEGATIVE, NEUTRAL}.
